results.name: Array T(n,k) = k*(k-1)^(n-1) read by ascending antidiagonals; k,n >= 1.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of n-letter words in a k-letter alphabet with no adjacent letters the same. The factor k represents the number of choices of the first letter, and the n-1 times repeated factor k-1 represents the choices of the next n-1 letters avoiding their predecessor.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10011(first 141 antidiagonals, flattened)
formula: G.f. for column k: k*x/(1-(k-1)*x). - _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 12 2015
G.f. for array: y/(y-1) - (1+1/x)*y*LerchPhi(y,1,-1/x). - _Robert Israel_, Dec 13 2018
example: T(3,3)=12 counts aba, abc, aca, acb, bab, bac, bca, bcb, cab, cac, cba, cbc. Words like aab or cbb are not counted.
program: for(n=2,15, for(k=1,n-1, print1(T(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 10 2019
T:= func< n,k | (n eq 1 and k eq 1) selec 1 else k*(k-1)^(n-k-1) >;
[[T(n, k) for k in (1..n-1)] for n in (2..15)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 10 2019
Flat(List([2..15], n-> List([1..n-1], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 10 2019
